newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end sharply up on share offload news.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end sharply up on share offload news.

text.p: Dhaka shares closed 2.22 percent up in a surge of buying by retail investors, encouraged by the news that the government would soon offload shares of 15 public companies to boost the capital market, brokers said.

"Retailers returned with big expectation after the news. They bought almost recklessly," said one broker. The Dhaka Stock Exchange rose 37.66 points or 2.22 percent at 1,726.53 on a turnover of 232.3 million taka. Of the 110 issues traded, 70 gained, 34 lost and six remained unchnaged.
Bangladesh Tobacco gained 9.39 taka to 268.58, IDLC gained 282.32 to 5,208.82 and Dhaka Fisheries lost 22.72 to 365.84.
